page.title: 11Sunday in Gringley (cont.)
page.content: Mr Sisum says that in the summer, Sunday is quite a busy day in the village:people pass by on ponies,some fish in the canal or there might be a special function.Mr Sisum thinks there is a good family atmosphere in Gringley. There's a butcher,P.O.& small shop (soon to close down)in the village but they aren't open on Sundays.Mr Sisum likes a day without shops: "No one can pressure you into buying things".He usually does 5-6 Hrs of school work:marking exercise books, planning Geography & Humanities lessons for the week ahead,completing administrative tasks for the 5th & 7th years' public examinations.Mr Sisum is glad he lives in Gringley and he wouldn't wish to change it. {Mr Sisum had a tape-recorded {interview with four 12yr olds in June {1985. }
